conclusion: Understanding how shadows change when the light source moves.
Object A's shadow is cast to the left.
Object B's shadow is cast to the right.
Object C's shadow is cast below.
Object D's shadow is cast to the right.
Light source is moved to the right and directly above the objects.
Object A's shadow will move to the right and be smaller.
Object B's shadow will move to the left and be smaller.
Object C's shadow will move to the right and be smaller.
Object D's shadow will move to the left and be smaller.
Final answer: A's shadow moves right and becomes smaller; B's shadow moves left and becomes smaller; C's shadow moves right and becomes smaller; D's shadow moves left and becomes smaller.
